alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Fentress; Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 7:58AM CDT until July 20 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Cumberland, Fentress and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms tracking towards the southeast. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cookeville, Crossville, Fairfield Glade, Algood, Monterey, Crab Orchard, Pleasant Hill, Slate Springs, Cumberland Mountain State Park and Lake Tansi. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
